title: The Circle: Jack and Beth kiss as players rumble Joyce is a catfish
text:
Jack and Beth have got close catfishing together as Joyce (Picture: Channel 4)

They’ve been flirting for days but we finally get to see Jack and Beth share a snog on tonight’s episode of The Circle.

We revealed that the couple would be locking lips soon after their close living arrangements soon became a flirtatious relationship.

After cuddles on the sofa and even lying in bed together in the mornings, the duo have been attempting to fool the others in the game into believing they’re actually 62-year-old Joyce.

Who know that catfishing could bloom into a romance so quickly?

Narrator Sophie Willan totally called their potential love match a few days ago, and told us at Metro.co.uk they’d likely hook up if they don’t kill each other first.

However, while they’ve been getting on like a house on fire in the flat that used to occupy Richard Madeley, the other players in the game are beginning to smell a rat.

And with neither of them particularly on the ball when it comes to old music and things a 62-year-old dog lover would know, it looks like they could well be rumbled.

The couple have even shared cosy mornings in bed together over the past couple of days (Picture: Channel 4)

Woody, Ella and Tim have been trying to scope out who could be lying to them all, and their sights are set on Joyce, after she failed to tell them what bands she saw at Reading Festival, despite claiming to attend.

On tonight’s episode, a trip down memory lane stumps them as they are asked about where they were when The Beatles legend John Lennon was shot and killed.

Woody thinks their eventual response is “nondescript” and Tim claims his overall suspicions have been raised to “fever pitch” when they try and claim they were in the supermarket when they heard.

Have they done enough to keep themselves safe another day? With a secret blocking about to occur as well, that could literally spell the end of them both.

Are we about to lose the first romance of the game before it’s even begun?

The Circle continues weeknights and Sundays at 10pm on Channel 4.
